results.title: L'Ecole Buissonniere = I Have a New Master
results.creator_credit: Jean-Paul Le Chanois, Pierre Laurent and Pierre Corti
results.brief_description:
At the end of WWI, Pascal Laurent, a young teacher, is sent to replace a retiring teacher in a small village of Provence. Pascal is keen on replacing the old authoritarian method of education with a new pedagogy. The children are soon won over, but Pascal’s unorthodox methods meet with the resistance from both his superiors and his students’ parents.

Credits: Producer, Pierre Corti, Pierre Laurent ; director, Jean-Paul Le Chanois ; writer, Jean-Paul Le Chanois ; photography, Marc Fossard, Maurice Pecqueux, Andre Dumaitre ; music, Joseph Kosma.
Cast: Bernard Blier, Juliette Faber, Edouard Delmont, Marcel Maupi, Edmond Ardisson, Henri Poupon, Gaston Modot, Lucien Callamand.

results.title: L'Eclipse du Soleil en Pleine Lune
results.brief_description: An aging astronomer invites students to his castle observatory to observe a solar eclipse. Amid the childish pranks of the novice astronomers and the wondrous vision of the eclipse, George Melies, cinema’s great magician, weaves numerous amusing set pieces. Much to the astronomer’s excitement, the sun and the moon flirt with each other as they come together in an astronomical courtship and the sky explodes in a dance of female stars. On earth, the astronomer falls prey to his cheeky students who rob him of his stately dignity, while the heavens smile down on him from above.

results.title: L'eau a la Bouche = to Each His Own
results.brief_description:
Milena lives with her grandmother in the Chateau d’Aubarede. At the death of the old woman, Milena invites two cousins, Seraphine and Jean-Paul, to attend the reading of the will. Seraphine arrives first accompanied by Robert, her lover, who decides to pass for Jean-Paul. Robert is fascinated with Milena and falls in love with her. As a means of revenge, Seraphine seduces young Miguel, the family lawyer. Then Jean-Paul arrives … The films contains several reference to classic films such as ‘La regle du jeu’ (Renoir, 1939) and ‘Smiles of a summer night’ (Bergman, 1958)

Credits: Producer, Pierre Braunberger ; director, Jacques Doniol-Valcroze ; writer, Jacques Doniol-Valcroze ; photography, Roger Fellous ; music, Serge Gainsbourg.
Cast: Bernadette Lafont, Michel Galabru, Alexandra Stewart, Francoise Brion, Gerard Barray, Paul Guers.

results.title: L'aventure de la Voile (Ep.3)
results.brief_description:
In this episode we learn about the gallows that were used as war machines well into the 17th century. This episode also covers the famous battle that oppsed Sr francis Drake to the Invincible Armada of the King of Spain. This episode also announces the changes heralded by the arrival of steam engines aboard commercial ships.

Credits: Directors, writers, Daniel Costelle, Jean-Marc Leblon ; photography, Jean-Claude Larrieu, Roland Bernard ; technical adviser, Michel Mollat.

results.title: L'auberge de la Mer Tranquille = the Inn of the Quiet Mother
results.brief_description:
Annette and Vidocq are enjoying a moment of rest at the Inn of the Quiet Mother. But their peace is disrupted by the arrival of a chain gang. The captain of the chain is Vidocq’s old ennemy, capitaine Thierry. Things take a turn for the worse when a convict recognises Vidocq.

Credits: Producer, Etienne Laroche ; director, Marcel Bluwal ; writer, Georges Neveux ; photography, Maurice Damien ; music, Serge Gainsbourg.
Cast: Bernard Noel, Alain Mottet, Genevieve Fontanel, Jacques Alric, Sacha Briquet, Marcel Charvet, Alain Janey, Dominique Zardi.

results.title: L'atalante [study extract]
results.brief_description: An extract from the last film directed by Jean Vigo, which tells the story of a young skipper of a barge who takes on board his newly-wed country girl, and their slow trip up the Seine towards Paris. The film relates their early love, disillusion, separation and final reconciliation. This extract deals with their separation. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: L'Atalante
results.creator_credit: Jean Vigo, Jacques Louis-Nounez, Gaumont-British Instructional and Argui-Films
results.brief_description: This simple love story involves a young barge skipper who installs his new wife on his barge which he works with an older man, Jules. The marriage falters and the wife deserts him in Paris. The film’s reputation and influence stems from the way Vigo injects an imaginary dream-like quality into more conventional passages of lyricism and the direct portrayal of working class life. In contrast to the couple the exotic, tattooed figure of Jules was a focus for Vigo. The intensity of the emotions and the strangeness of the images has been variously labelled ‘poetic realism’ and ‘surreal lyricism’. Cast includes Michel Simon, Dita Parlo and Jean Daste. In French with English subtitles. This restored version includes an additional 8 min. of footage.

results.title: L'associe = the Associate
results.brief_description:
Julien Pardot, a rather dull corporate executive invents an ‘assistant’, the dynamic, go-getting ‘Mr. Davis’ on whom all the important decisions depend. Pretending to be Mr. Davis’ intermediary, Pardot at last makes it big in the business world. A crisis develops when Pardot’s investors demand to meet Mr. Davis in person—and when several young ladies show up, claiming to be the mothers of Mr. Davis’ children. Re-made as ‘The Associate’ (1996), with Whoopie Goldberg. Both are a re-makes of the 1939 film ‘The Mysterious Mr. Davis’ directed by Claude Autant-Lara with a cast of British actors, including Alastair Sim.

Credits: Producer, Simone Allouche ; director, Rene Gainville ; writers, Rene Gainville, Jean-Claude Carriere ; photography, Etienne Szabo ; music, Michel Bernholc, Mort Schuman.
Cast: Michel Serrault, Claudine Auger, Catherine Alric, Judith Magre, Henri Virlojeux, Mathieu Carriere.

results.title: L'assassin Habite Au 21 = the Killer Is at No. 21
results.brief_description:
A murder takes place at a boarding house full of eccentrics, each one a likely suspect. Clouzot, whose films are generally dark in character, made his feature debut with this delightful comedy-thriller of ‘The Thin Man’ type. The films is not one of these intimidating masterpieces that mark the history of [French] cinema. It is an unpretentious and entertaining piece, solidly built around 2 main centers of interest: the sarcastic and spicy exploration of a boarding house and the colourful fauna living inside it”. Reference: Le Nouvel Observateur, 3 April 1987. German censorship had all the scenes featuring Linz’s interrogation cut out of the film because they were judged too violent. Clouzot had asked the actors playing the police not to fake the action and actor Noel Roquevert who plays Linz finished the scene with a swollen face.

Credits: Director, Henri-Georges Clouzot ; writer, Henri-Georges Clouzot ; photography, Armand Thirard ; music, Maurice Yvain.
Cast: Pierre Fresnay, Suzy Delair, Pierre Larquey, Noel Roquevert, Jean Tissier, Louis Florencie, Raymond Bussieres, Odette Talazac, Marc Natol, Huguette Vivier.

results.title: L'armee Roulante = the Rolling Army
results.brief_description:
Vidocq, Annette and friend are travelling with brand new IDs. What they don’t know is that the man who sold the papers to them works for Flambart and that their new identities belong to two army deserters.

Credits: Producer, Etienne Laroche ; director, Marcel Bluwal ; writer, Georges Neveux ; photography, Maurice Damien ; music, Serge Gainsbourg.
Cast: Bernard Noel, Alain Mottet, Genevieve Fontanel, Jacques Alric, Jacques Aveline, Jaxques Rispal, Martin Trevieres.
